core_concepts.snippet: Nanobanana ha sido una revolución. Es la mejor herramienta para generar, editar y transformar imágenes. Y además la puedes utilizar de un modo completamente gratuito. Su potencial es enorme
Nano Banana from Google, officially known as Gemini 2.5/image
Nano Banana is part of Gemini 2.5, giving it a good understanding of the world and natural language.
Nano Banana excels at collaborative edits through natural language, allowing for various image manipulations like changing hairstyles, eye color, etc.
Nano Banana's image editing capabilities have led to discussions about Photoshop's obsolescence.
Nano Banana produces images with low fidelity, especially in the Gemini app, making upscaling a recommended post-processing step.
Nano Banana struggles with precise aspect ratio control and making multiple small, consecutive edits.
Nano Banana is a powerful tool for product photo creation, ad making, and landing page design.
Nano Banana can generate various creative content such as fonts, business cards, and character designs.
Nano Banana can be used to create consistent characters across multiple scenes, maintaining style and details.
Nano Banana's combination with video tools unlocks various possibilities for animation and video content creation.
Nano Banana can be used for B-roll creation and style/character changes in existing videos.
Nano Banana is available for free in Google AI Studio, and with unlimited access on Freepik's higher plans.
Nano Banana is a significant leap forward in AI image editing technology.
Nano Banana, also known as Gemini 2.5 flash image, retains character and scene consistency while allowing you to change anything about the image that you want by simply typing to it in plain English.
The way it works is that you give it an image, you give it a prompt, and it completely changes the look of the image by just describing what you want to be changed.
The only limitation is that the resolution dimensions of the output image will be the same as that of the input image.

technical_details.snippet: Simplemente tenéis que tener una cuenta de Google, entrar a esta dirección de aquíudio.google.com y aseguraros que empezáis a chatear con el modelo Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Preview activado.
Nano Banana is accessible through the Gemini app and Google AI Studio.
Google AI Studio offers free access to Nano Banana, but with image and video generation limitations.
Freepik provides unlimited Nano Banana access on higher-tier plans, without watermarks and less image compression.
Nano Banana by Google available to you in Gemini and Google AI Studio
You can now access Nano Banana on the API and create powerful apps that you've never done before.
AI Studio which has direct access of 2.5 flash image model and start using it to build any app that you want to and see how it looks.

expert_opinions.snippet: This might be the best form of character consistency we've had. Something we've been waiting for such a long time for.

competitor_comparison.snippet: ChatGBT and Flux Context have similar natural language editing capabilities, but Nano Banana is much better.
Nano Banana is far better at creating consistent characters across scenes than Flex Context or ChachiPT.
Midjourney's aesthetics are hard to beat, but Nano Banana's can replacement feature is very effective.
ChatchiBT struggles with preserving image integrity when making edits, unlike Nano Banana.
I've tried Flux. I've tried all the other image generation models and this was always a big problem.

future_trends.snippet: I will spend a lot more time experimenting.
Google's nano banana is just the starting of what the future of image editing would look like. It would only improve from here.
